intro: Astephanus grazielae, commonly known as the Graham's stephania, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
